docs.lead_paragraph: Only 18 percent of women in early labor were given injections to help the child after birth and drugs to delay labor. A total of 42 percent received neither.

headline.main: Premature Labor Drugs Underused, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Premature Labor Drugs Underused, Study Says

docs.abstract: Dr Joshua Vogel study in journal The Lancet finds that only 18 percent of women worldwide receive two key drugs during premature labor that can help child's chance of survival, and that 42 percent receive neither; research indicates that use of antenatal corticosteroids is far too low.
docs.snippet: Only 18 percent of women in early labor were given injections to help the child after birth and drugs to delay labor. A total of 42 percent received neither.

docs.lead_paragraph: Medicare’s five-year-old rating system to help families select nursing homes relies on unverified, incomplete and often misleading data.

headline.main: Medicare Star Ratings Allow Nursing Homes to Game the System
headline.print_headline: Ratings Allow Nursing Homes to Game System

docs.abstract: Examination of Medicare's rating system of nursing homes by The New York Times has found that many top-ranked nursing homes have been given seal of approval that is based on incomplete information and can mislead consumers; Medicare ratings, which have become gold standard across the country, are based in large part on self-reported data by nursing homes that government does not verify.
docs.snippet: Medicare’s five-year-old rating system to help families select nursing homes relies on unverified, incomplete and often misleading data.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Friday offered compromises intended to address objections by some nonprofit groups and private companies over providing contraceptive coverage.

headline.main: Administration Proposes New Health Rules Addressing Religious Objections
headline.print_headline: Administration Proposes Rules to Address Objections Over Contraceptive Coverage

docs.abstract: Obama administration proposes new regulations intended to address religious objections that some nonprofit organizations and private companies have to providing contraceptive coverage for their employees.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration on Friday offered compromises intended to address objections by some nonprofit groups and private companies over providing contraceptive coverage.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Often ignored by front-rank architects, left to corporate specialists who churn out too many heartless buildings, hospitals are a critical frontier for design.

headline.main: In Redesigned Room, Hospital Patients May Feel Better Already
headline.print_headline: In Redesigned Room, Hospital Patients May Feel Better Already

docs.abstract: Michael Kimmelman Critic's Notebook notes research showing that well-designed patient rooms in hospitals can both improve patient's perception of care they are being given and reduce pain; findings have potential benefit both hospitals and patients by reducing costs and time in hospital and hastening recovery; both design firms and hospitals are taking notice.
docs.snippet: Often ignored by front-rank architects, left to corporate specialists who churn out too many heartless buildings, hospitals are a critical frontier for design.

docs.lead_paragraph: Responses to an Op-Ed essay, “Perpetuating Schizophrenia’s Stigma.”
docs.snippet: Responses to an Op-Ed essay, “Perpetuating Schizophrenia’s Stigma.”

docs.lead_paragraph: New rules for dispensing hydrocodone, the most widely prescribed painkiller in the United States, include no phoned-in prescriptions and no refills.

headline.main: In Move to Curb Drug Abuse, D.E.A. Tightens Rule on Widely Prescribed Painkiller
headline.print_headline: In Move to Curb Drug Abuse, D.E.A. Tightens Rule on Widely Prescribed Painkiller

docs.abstract: Drug Enforcement Administration tightens rule on hydrocodone, most widely prescribed painkiller in United States and ingredient in drugs like Vicodin, placing it in more restrictive category; move is among far-reaching efforts to stem growing epidemic of prescription drug abuse and overdose.
docs.snippet: New rules for dispensing hydrocodone, the most widely prescribed painkiller in the United States, include no phoned-in prescriptions and no refills.
